intro: Tetragonanthus dombeyanus, commonly known as the Dombey's tetragonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed beyond its native range.
